doc.after: With the pullout of military forces from Amchitka in 1950, the Department of Defense initially considered the island for nuclear testing planned for 1951. Requiring information about the cratering potential of nuclear weapons, plans were made to detonate two 20-kiloton (84Â TJ) devices.[5] After approximately 34 test holes had been drilled, the site was deemed unsuitable,[17] and the project was moved to the Nevada test site.[5]
